title: Ticket #5420: HTCondor incorrectly preempting jobs
description:
On both the LIGO and CMS glidein pools, we see consistent issue with slots being preempted despite the fact preemption is disabled.

I suspect there's a lack of transaction safety here - the negotiator has a private ad corresponding to a preempting claim but a public ad corresponding to when the slot was unclaimed.

Two suggestions:

  1. In the private ad, record the current state/activity. If it does not match the state/activity of the public ad, do not hand out a claim.
  2. Add a counter to the private and public ad; reject the private ad if the counters do not match in the negotiator.

In other words, we try to make sure the private ad reasonably matches the public ad. The latter is more foolproof (consider what happens if a slot goes unclaimed->claimed->unclaimed between the two ad queries), the first would likely have a smaller performance impact.
remarks:
2015-Nov-30 17:08:02 by tannenba:
Hi Brian,

First a few questions:

  1. Are the slots you observe being preempted static slots or dynamic slots? (my guess is dynamic slots)

  2. Are both pools using a "collector tree"?

  3. How did you observe the situation where "the negotiator has a private ad corresponding to a preempting claim but a public ad corresponding to when the slot was unclaimed" ?

Now some brainstorming:

I cannot see how this would happen with static slots, but I imagine it could potentially happen with dynamic slots. In addition to your suggestions above, a third option would be to do away with private ads all together and instead have the startd put the claim right into the public ad as a private attribute. This would fix any transaction safety issue, potentially make the central manager more scalable (not sure about this, as we'd save the time by not creating a new classad but potentially take up time encrypting/decrypting the private attribute), always encrypt the capability between the startd and collector, and simplify the collector code moving forward.

If you come back and say that this unwanted preemption is happening on static slots, then I would be baffled because of how things are supposed to be implemented (according to the design) with respect to static slots:

  • The startd is supposed to always generate fresh new claim ids (both public and private) whenever a slot enters back into unclaimed.
  • Updates sent to the collector from the startd should contain both the public and private ads in the same message, thus the updates should arrive atomically.
  • The collector does do two separate queries, but it should query the private ads first and then subsequently fetch all the public ads.

Given the above three design rules, it is hard to see how the matchmaker could end up with a preempting claim in the private ad and an unclaimed public ad when using static slots. Unless of course there is an implementation bug or regression. :O.
